aws:cdk:cloudformation:props.description: Automatically created by the RestApi construct

ec2InstanceType.description:
Supported Ec2 Instance Type. Supported are:
t2.large - 2 CPU, 8 GB RAM
t2.xlarge - 4 CPU, 16 GB RAM

gitRepo.description:
Name of supported Alfresco Docker Compose Deployment deployed with the Alfresco installer.
alf-ec-1 : ACS 6.2 Community, ACA

userId.description: Simple user name. Please use your user name from the system.

alfInstanceId.description: User Instance Identifier created with node uuid. Consists of 5 characters!

expectedStatus.description: The state you are allow to put your instance in. Warning putting instances into terminated will delete the instance-conf and instance!

alfInstanceId.description: User Instance Identifier created with node uuid. Consists of 5 characters!

status.description: Shows the current state. Even if your instance is in the running state it might take some minutes until the provided url is reachable.

url.description:
The Url to access ACA. Currently only http is supported. Urls are ACA = ../ Share = ../share Alfresco = ../alfresco . It takes up to 3 minutes until this url becomes available. In future I plan to implement a healthcheck (probably leveraging AWS AutoScaling) to make the readiness of ACS more feaseble.

The propagation of the DNS Record normally takes a bit longer. Alternatively you can use the awsUrl to access your instance.

awsUrl.description: Alternative url for the Alfresco instance.
